result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Michael Wood

defendant.name: Wood, Shawn Michael
defendant.address: 1300 Main St. Unit 210, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:02 pm.

2:34 PM Shawn Michael Wood appears in Court,  Atty Derek W Sanders, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Christopher Kober. S/T. DA Hatch questions Officer Kober. Objection to identification. DA Hatch renews her request for identification of DE. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Sanders.Redirect DA Hatch. DA Hatch is asking the Court to find probable cause and bind DE over. Atty Sanders argues, DA Hatch argues. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Motion hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center for fingerprints and photograph. 
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH S.R.S. OR T.L.W.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 9:34 AM Defendant Shawn Michael Wood in Court, Atty Stephanie Schmidt,  ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 signature bond w/conditions of no contact w/S.R.S. ot T.L.W.,  no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits. Court adjourned at 9:39 am. Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
